item.Title: Project Administrator
item.Description:
Established mid-sized NYC architectural firm is seeking a full-time Project Administrator with experience in architecture industry to join our dynamic,multi-disciplinary team. Applicants should be highly organized and motivated and demonstrate design sensibility. Successful candidates will work closely with Senior Principal on projects of various types.
Skills& Qualifications:
- 3-5 years minimum experience in architecture industry required - A general understanding of architecture practice and project phases - Ability to interpret architectural drawings preferred - Understanding of project scheduling - Bachelor’s Degree, ideally with a Major in Architecture
Responsibilities:
- Work with team members in the production of contract and proposal documents - Monitor budgets and schedules, identify potential shortfalls and take necessary action to prevent negative impact on critical path - Interact with various levels of design team, subcontractors, and vendors, as well as clients - Provide project-related administrative support to Senior Principal, including scheduling meetings, preparing correspondence, preparing meeting agendas, taking meeting notes, preparing reports - Perform other duties and responsibilities as required
The ideal candidate will:
- Have the ability to manage time, tasks, and people - Possess excellent problem solving and decision-making skills - Thrive in a fast-paced environment and have the ability to multi-task - Be detail-oriented, efficient, and adaptable to changing deadlines and priorities - Have strong organizational skill and communication skills - Demonstrate enthusiastic commitment to our team-focused environment - Have a willingness to learn and take direction from Seniors - Have experience working on a wide range of project types
Firm provides competitive salary, health benefits, profit-sharing and 401(k).

item.Title: Senior Healthcare Designer/Studio Director
item.Description:
SBLM Architects is currently seeking a Senior Healthcare Designer. Candidate must display excellent creative and visual presentation skills along with good communication and management skills.
Job Responsibilities: • Manages design process for entire project; leads/directs the work of other designers and technical staff • Defines program requirements and establishes design parameters based on client requirements • Creates and develops overall design concepts, formulates design presentation strategies and makes compelling presentations • Manages design team members during the implementation of design to ensure the intent and quality of concept is maintained throughout project delivery • Manages client interaction and decision making related to design • Monitors project budget and schedule related to design team efforts • Participate in business development and marketing activities
Requirements: • Applicant should have a minimum of 5 years of experience and be proficient in AutoCAD. • Applicant should have a thorough understanding of Healthcare programming, conceptual layouts, equipment planning and material & finish selections. • Applicant should have working knowledge of graphic rendering programs including 3D Studio Max, Photoshop and Sketch Up. • Bachelor Degree in Architecture or BS in Architecture Tech. is required.
Compensation and Benefits: • We offer a competitive salary and benefits package commensurate with the level of experience and a creative and innovative work environment. • Our benefits package includes Medical/Dental/Vision insurance plans, 401k Retirement, Flexible Spending Plan and much more. • Our company culture features professional learning and growth opportunities, rewarding project types to participate in and free ongoing professional educational programs.

item.Title: Construction Project Manager ( Denver, CO)
item.Description:
Job Location: Denver, Colorado
Job Duration: Base plus four option years. Total 5 years
Minimum Education:
4-year degree in architecture, landscape architecture, mechanical, civil, electrical, structural, geotechnical or general engineering or construction management.
Minimum Experience: 4 years Project Management experience as follows:
“Field work”, including practices and procedures of candidates’ specific discipline, such as engineering, landscape architecture, architecture, or resource planning. Management of simple-to-complex design and construction projects containing multi-year phasing and overlapping schedules, high visibility, multiple functions (design, construction, planning), controversy, unusual design/construction components with novel problems requiring unique solutions, significant political interest/oversight, and jurisdictional disputes Knowledge of project management concepts, and understanding of authorities, responsibilities, and accountabilities of the "project management philosophy". Written and verbal communication, problem-solving, and conflict resolution skills Knowledge of contract administration and compliance Knowledge of software including Microsoft Project, Word and Excel Positive attitude and ability to get along with diverse groups of people
Performance Requirements:
Assists the Project Manager (PM) as a technical point of contact for assigned projects. Supports PM in cradle-to-grave project execution and completion of assigned tasks from design through construction. Coordinates with various stakeholders and team members through all phases of a project. During design, coordinates with other key staff/expertise and reviews A/E firms’ execution and deliverables (design drawings, specifications, supplemental reports, cost estimates, inspection and trip reports, etc.). During construction, coordinates project needs with construction management (CM) firms, construction contractors, and other NPS (Park and Region) staff. Assists PM in maintaining project compliance, quality, scope, budget and programming criteria. Identifies problems and coordinates solutions with the PM, resolves technical and schedule issues as needed, and develops corrective actions to ensure successful project accomplishment. Performs workload outside of the candidate’s specific discipline. Travels occasionally for on-site inspections, investigations, and meetings often requiring a significant amount of walking, bending and climbing. Field trips are often in the outdoors and may experience weather extremes, insect bites, varied topography and other physical demands.

item.Title: If you are looking for a rewarding Mechanical Technician Career
item.Description:
If you are looking for a rewarding Mechanical Technician Career COME JOIN US AT OUR Next JOB FAIR, YOU'RE INVITED!!! ON THE SPOT INTERVIEWS. IF YOU ATTEND YOU WILL BE INTERVIEWED.
Date : Sunday September 22, 2019 Time: 2pm- 5pm Location : Carousall Room: Training Room Coney Island, Brooklyn, NY 11224 We are looking to HIRE amazing people who will make lifetime memories for themselves and our guest. If you believe that person is you, feel free to bring a RESUME in hand.
Job Description
Maintain, erect, repair and troubleshoot electro-mechanical equipment and ensure their safe operation. The Mechanical Technician will perform inspections and troubleshoot electro-mechanical equipment. Ensure that the electro-mechanical equipment is kept clean and compliant with manufacturers specifications, industry standards, and corresponding government agencies SKILLS: -Must have at least 3 years of prior experience in the maintenance, troubleshooting, and repair of mechanical/electro-mechanical systems. -Able to comprehend and execute inspection procedures. -Experience in using instrumentation i.e. Multimeter, caliper, and others -Prior experience with Programmable Logic Controllers (PLC’s) or Relay logic is a plus. -Candidates must possess a strong work ethic and be safety conscious -Candidates must possess the ability to read, write and communicate in English to sufficiently perform the key duties of the Maintenance Technician. -Other optional skills are the following; experience in welding, machining and the understanding of electrical/hydraulic/pneumatic schematics and control systems. PHYSICAL DEMANDS:
Must be able to work in all weather conditions including exposure to direct sunlight. Must be able to lift, carry, move, and/or position items weighing up to or in excess of 75 pounds. Must be able to lift 80 pounds consistently and carry over 25 feet of various surfaces Must be able to lift and lower 25 pounds above shoulder level Able to work at heights over 120 ft.
Reports to: Maintenance Manager/ Director
Job Type: Full-time Please bring your resume with you and be Dressed professional.

item.Title: Mechanical Engineer for Rapidly Growing Med Device Company
item.Description:
(*Boston to Nashua area only* -- will pay to relocate the right person)
ROM3 is a three-year-old medical technology company that has created and patented a revolutionary orthopedic rehabilitation device (see our product video at www.rom3rehab.com). We have been well-funded, having raised $19.1 million to date and are currently planning for a public offering within the next nine months.
We are looking for an exceptional consultant Mechanical Engineer in the Boston to Nashua area (Northern MA Southern NH) for a 4-8 week project. The Candidate is expected to help with the finalization and transfer to production of a unique post-surgery rehabilitation device. Must be familiar with electro-mechanical assemblies and plastic molded parts and able to hit the ground running. The successful applicant will be assisting our lead designer to move from prototype to production in record time, hence experience and productivity are key. Possible longer-term involvement for the right match.
In addition to the skills and competencies described below, we seek candidates who are open, honest and candid. Compensation is based on experience, accomplishments, and proven success in this role.
The Mechanical Engineer will have: • A passion for simple and elegant mechanical design • A portfolio of design work • Experience developing and refining prototypes • Experience designing for manufacturing at scale • An ability to work well under pressure to meet aggressive deadlines • Highly proficient with CAD (Solidworks) – solid modeling, assemblies, drawing generation • Experience with BOM generation, revision control • Minimum of 8+ years experience in mechanical engineering • Strong oral and written communication skills.
Additional consideration if you have: • Previous start-up experience • Developed mechanical medical devices • Developed exercise equipment • Hands-on experience with fabrication (CAM, CNC etc)
Qualified candidates, please respond via email to this ad and include: • A cover letter detailing why you are a great fit for this job. Please state your current hourly pay requirement. • An up-to-date resume
Thank you for your interest.

item.Title: Trainee Project Manager at High-End Glass Wall Company
item.Description:
Hi! Thanks for your interest, please check out the details below, and if it seems like the right position for you, feel free to reach out with any questions:
JOB DESCRIPTION Wing Partners is looking for an energetic person to join our training program to become a Project Manager. No project management experience is necessary to join as a trainee. You'll learn everything from experienced project managers who manage multi-million dollar projects, building workplaces for fortune 500 companies. We specialize in glass wall systems for office interiors. (Check out our website for photos www.wingpartners.com). Please note that this is not a design role, and you should have some architecture, engineering or construction training.
You will be consulting with designers on the customization capabilities of our wall systems and coordinating the build-out of our clients' designs. You will interact with architects, especially during the drafting of shop drawings and submitting finish samples for approval. You'll assist our Project Managers in the office and in the field on active jobsites with reviewing bid requests, drafting and submitting shop drawings, and following the entire project timeline from bidding to completion.
RESPONSIBILITIES * Review construction documents, put together bid packages * Develop shop drawings in AutoCAD (or Revit if you know it) * Field verification measurements * Attend construction coordination meetings * Assist with scheduling of deliveries and supervision of installers
REQUIREMENTS * Proficiency in AutoCAD, Excel and Word. * Experience with Revit is a plus, but not required. * Be able to read and understand construction documents * Must be able to communicate with clients as well as general contractors and field labor. * Self-driven, detail oriented, well organized. * Located in the NYC metro area
COMPENSATION AND TIME 40 hours per week, with a salary paid bi-weekly. Typical hours are 9am-6pm, with occasional meetings starting at 8am. Training program lasts 90-180 days depending on performance. Health benefits are available after a waiting period of 60 days. With excellent performance you'll graduate from Trainee to full Project Manager, which includes a pay raise.
ABOUT US Wing Partners is a full-service distributor of modern, high-end customized glass wall systems. We work closely with architects and interior designers to help them achieve their visions for the workplaces of clients such as IBM, Under Armour, AMC, Heineken, Coach, NBA, Nike, and many more. At Wing Partners, we're a small tight-knit group who works hard and likes to have fun. We're based in Chelsea, New York City.
CONTACT Check out our website at WingPartners.com. To apply, please email Michael with your resume/cv and a cover letter using the indeed link. Thanks!

item.Description:
PM/Drafting position - Safety design coordinator for a Major NYC Safety Consulting Company We are looking for a full-time CAD PM/Draftsman to join our dynamic Production team. As a member of this fast-paced, cutting edge group you will work with architects, engineers and construction specialists to handle the drawing and graphic needs for industry leading developers and construction managers.

Knowledgeable of codes and regulations including NYC Building Code, NYC Fire Code & DOT regulations.
Proficient in reviewing DOB-BEST Squad objections and maintaining Building Code, the client's preferences, and design intent.
Meet with New York City Department of Buildings Plan Examiners to review and obtain approvals of Site Safety Plans.
Good drafting skills. Must be able to balance CAD drafting (For Site Safety Logistics Plans for Alterations, Facade Repairs & New Buildings), project management and coordination.
Perform Quality Assurance reviews of drawing sets.
Conduct site visits for field measurements and drawing research.
Develop and produce presentation materials, including plans, diagrams, details, etc
Communicate and follow up with clients about specific projects and their goals.
Prepare daily & weekly reports.
Qualifications: 1. Bachelors Degree in Architecture, Civil engineering or closely related field preferred. 2. 2-5 years architectural design/CAD drafting work experience, minimum 1 year in Project Coordination, or Management. 3. Must have EXCELLENT computer skills. Proficient in CAD software and/or AutoCAD experience is required. REVIT knowledge is a plus. Proficiency in Photoshop and/or illustrator, PowerPoint, Excel and Word is necessary as well. 4. Complex problem solving and decision-making skills. 5. Good written and verbal communication skills 6. Must be a team player and have the ability to effectively multi-task 7. Strong leadership, communication and relationship management skills. 8. Flexibility in a fast-paced changing environment. 9. Working knowledge of NYC Building Code, Chapter 33 Safeguards During Construction or Demolition as well as OSHA CFR 1926 Construction Safety and Health and NYC DOT
We offer a competitive salary (commensurate with experience), with paid vacation and benefits package. Recent college grads welcome to apply!
item.Compensation: We offer a competitive salary (commensurate with experience), with paid vacation

item.Title: ECB/Vioaltion and Demolitions expediter
item.Description:
Hello, I have a small/midish size office and looking to add to the team. I need an expediter who HAS KNOWLEDGE AND EXPERIENCE with ECB/FDNY/DOT violations. You need to be able to work independently to make your own Certificate of corrections and attend court. You will be responsible to follow up and organize your violations. You have to be able to argue violations based on issuance and merit in court.
The second part of your job is Demolitions. I need you to deal with Demolitions including cutoffs, ordering pest control, submit plans to Best, organizing with the Engineer of record. And occasionally dealing with Best regarding Stop work Orders.
If you want to work and know how to work our team is looking for someone. Please contact me. Position is only for work described above. All other positions are filled I need violations and Demolitions. I am not willing to teach I need someone who can handle the work. We have the best laid back and fun office in the industry but you need to come in knowing this work I will not train but I will guide and offer full support staff. PART TIME CAN work as well.
item.Compensation: Let me know how much you would like and show me what you can do. VIOLATIONS AND DEMOS lets roll!

item.Title: Facade / Building Envelope Structural Engineer
item.Description:
, New York City's leading professional firm dedicated to the preservation of buildings and infrastructure, is seeking a resourceful, skilled structural engineer with 5 to 6 years of building envelope restoration experience if licensed, and 7 to 10 years' experience if not licensed, to join us in executing a growing slate of challenging projects.
We work on an array of building types, including courthouses, schools, universities, churches, and hospitals, and many of New York's most storied landmarks, from Trinity Church to Grand Central Terminal. Our work embraces all components of the building envelope and underlying structure—facades, roofs, windows, and plazas—and the full complement of materials, from historic terra-cotta to high-performance curtain walls. We’re proud to be an industry leader in crucial practice areas like Local Law 11 inspections and repairs. We've won numerous awards, as well as the loyalty of many of the premier public, corporate, and residential clients in the region.
You’ll work as part of a small team assigned to projects based on synergies between project requirements and the capabilities of each team member. This arrangement offers employees the dual advantages of a small office experience coupled with access to the centralized resources of a larger firm. You'll be supported by some of the most sophisticated technology in the profession, including proprietary computer systems and applications, advanced photography and image processing, and state-of-the-art, non-destructive diagnostic equipment and techniques.
Typically, you’ll participate in all phases of a project from inception through completion: proposal, investigation, construction documents, bid negotiation, and construction administration. You'll have the opportunity to see your designs executed in the field and you'll take on greater responsibility and client management as soon as you are ready.
We offer an array of benefits and growth opportunities: :
Our light-filled Tribeca office is in a landmarked building with 16' high ceilings, 8' tall windows, and stunning views of Manhattan in three directions—not a bad place to spend the work day. We’re easily accessible via public transportation: the A, C, and E Canal Street station connects directly to our building’s lobby. The N, R, 1, and 6 lines are all just a few blocks away.
If you’re excited about this opportunity, please send us your resume, a cover letter with salary requirements, and a few pages of attachments (maximum of 10MB, please) or link to your portfolio that demonstrates your experience and capabilities.
With thanks for your interest, please note that only those candidates under consideration will be contacted.
For additional information on our firm’s services, approach, and projects, visit

item.Title: Project Engineer (Fairfield)
item.Description:
Baggage Handling Systems design consulting firm has an immediate need for a Project Engineer in our Connecticut office.
Our firm, BNP Associates, Inc. specializes in the design of automated baggage handling and screening, parcel, cargo and apron systems for airports throughout the world. We are the market leader in all of these fields and our employees are respected industry leaders. We are seeking the best of the best to help us grow and excel.
Mechanical engineering, architectural engineering, or a construction management background is preferred, however, civil, industrial and electrical engineers may be considered with relevant knowledge or experience.
BNP Associates, Inc. specializes in the design of automated baggage handling and screening, parcel, cargo and apron systems for airports throughout the world. The position will be based out of our Fairfield, CT office; however, travel will be required so the ability and willingness to do so is a must.
This engineering position will provide the successful candidate with a broad array of opportunities to utilize their talents. We are seeking an individual who has considerable attention to detail and will contribute to our team of airport system consultants in project roles from the preparation of design and specification documents, cost estimating, project management through on-site installation and commissioning efforts. Excellent written and verbal communication skills are required. We utilize the latest software package technology in our design efforts, including recent releases of AutoCAD, Revit, AutoMod, PathPlanner, and Microsoft Office suite of programs, so experience in any of these would be beneficial.
We are looking for a local candidate, and as such, no relocation package is being offered for this position.
Projects that the successful candidate will participate in will require federal background checks and drug screening. We are an equal opportunity employer. We offer an excellent benefits package and competitive salaries, along with professional advancement opportunities.
If you are seeking a rewarding career that provides you the opportunity to become a significant contributor in the fast paced, dynamic environment of airport systems design, please send your cover letter, resume, and a list of references to bnphq@bnpassociates.com

Knowledge of interior building surfaces and materials. He or she will have experience with building condition assessments inspections and generating computer-based reports.

item.Title: Field Service Engineer
item.Description:
Job Description
One of the 3D Printing leading companies in the United States is currently seeking a responsible, professional and experienced 3D Printing Field Service Technician.
The 3D Printing Field Service Technician ensures optimum operational performance for hardware related to 3D Printers installed at the customers' site. They deliver technical service to customers including installation, relocation, repair, and preventative maintenance. This person will provide technical and operational support of 3D printing equipment and systems located within the following types of environments: business/corporate, educational and military specifications.
Responsibilities: • Ensure optimum operational performance for systems installed at the customer's site • Optimize system performance to minimize equipment downtime and ensure maximum overall customer satisfaction • Be dispatched and directed by their supervisor with a primary function of repairing customer's equipment • Frequent travel to perform onsite equipment installs, maintenance, and upgrades • Familiarize customer with product usage and care • Availability for occasional off-hours calls and work • Read and interpret documents such as safety rules, operating and maintenance instructions, wiring diagrams, flowcharts, and procedure manuals • Write routine reports and correspondence
Education & Training Requirements: • AA degree, a two-year diploma from a technical school or military ratings such as Naval ET, FC or FT required • 3-5 years of related electrical, mechanical &/or technical experience. • BS in engineering field preferred but not required • Solid knowledge of remote support tools, TCP/IP protocol, and computer science • Solid skills in Microsoft Office and strong troubleshooting skills with mechanical/electrical systems.
Requirements: • Must have a hands-on approach • Ability to read an electrical schematic and mechanical drawings • Strong customer service experience required • Skills in organization, problem-solving, and customer relations • Basic interpersonal and communication skills in the business environment and a commitment to professionally represent the company with its customers • Ability to speak effectively before customers and act in an advisory capacity • Working effectively and efficiently under tight deadlines • Ability to work at customer locations independently with minimal support • Must have a driver's license
Benefits: Excellent employee environment with a competitive benefits package including: • Salary commensurate with experience • Great Benefits package including Health Insurance + 401k • Stable company with growing revenue • Work with cutting edge technologies in many spaces
EEO/AA/V/D/M/F/SO Job Type: Full-time

item.Title: Entry Level Electrical Engineering
item.Description:
Highland Associates is a full service architectural, engineering and interior design firm, offering a single source of responsibility for all design and project administration disciplines. Staff performs: architecture; interior design; facility master planning and programming; HVAC, electrical, plumbing, fire protection, and structural engineering; project management; code analysis, site utilization/selection and real estate services.
Currently hiring Entry Level Electrical Engineering to be trained in design of electrical systems for commercial and institutional facilities (new construction, renovation, fit-up and rehabilitation projects, high rise buildings), including, but not limited to: power distribution systems, emergency power generation and uninterruptible power systems, electrical system trouble shooting, lighting control systems; building and site infrastructure upgrades. Must be proficient in electric circuit and systems design. Must have knowledge of AutoCAD. BSEE required. (No computer majors)
item.Compensation: Salary commensurate with experience, 401(K), Health & Life Insurance, Vacation Days, Sick Days

item.Title: Kitchen & Bath Designer - Experienced
item.Description:
Hi-end Kitchen & Bath Showroom/Contractor seeking experienced, talented Kitchen & Bath designer/sales person to join our team! Must be bilingual - Fluent in English and Chinese.
Skills  Creative kitchen & bath designer (CKD, CBD a plus)  Working knowledge of kitchen and bath remodeling process.  Ability to execute the contract from concept to completion.  Knowledge of electrical & plumbing requirements  Proficient in Auto Cad, Excel, Word  Understanding of the luxury K&B cabinetry market  Ability to sell to high end clients  Knowledge of sales techniques including closing  Working knowledge of current kitchen & bath design trends.  Jobsite Experience (measuring, layouts, general understanding of residential custom home construction process, etc.) plus ability to do accurate measurement for material orders.  Proven ability to work both independently and in a team environment  Detailed oriented  Organized  Insure customer satisfaction as if you were on the receiving end.
Job Functions  Responsible for selling, designing & developing residential Kitchen & Bath Designs and guide client selections  Prepare complete design of kitchen & bath projects, including floor plan, elevations and complete detailed drawings for installers so they have a clear understanding of scope of work.  Include electrical & plumbing requirements in design  Complete Client Information Form  Complete all designs necessary for the owner's projects.  Provide great customer service to clients  Ask clients for referrals & testimonials at the completion of the project  Attend factory training & new product launches  Engage and develop new business opportunities through prospecting, social and professional networking

item.Title: Architectural Construction Admin/ Field Representative (18-24 months)
item.Description:
Senior level, onsite construction administration field representative needed for 18-24 months. Multiple projects, predominantly in Brooklyn and S.I. NYC. Job responsibilities entail monitoring progress and quality of construction work and confirm conformance with contract documents. Respond to RFI's, participate in project meetings and prepare meeting minutes. Maintain on-site project records, process change orders and review submittals' conformance with documents as well as maintain activity logs, etc. Possibly also providing in-house support at our midtown office. Opportunity to stay on in firm after project completion, long term growth potential.
Qualifications:
8 years minimum, with extensive CA experience. MS Office; PDF mark ups Revit and/or AutoCAD ability required Architectural License preferred or additional related experience necessary

item.Title: Construction Site Supervisor/Manager
item.Description:
A dynamic, growth-oriented construction company G.C. serving the NYC metro market.
POSITION SUMMARY: Site Super with strong technical skills who can support the job and PM with expert advice about execution of all trades. Must be able to communicate with clients, as well workers. All site related coordination and scheduling.
ESSENTIAL ROLES and RESPONSIBILITIES • Careful review plans and specifications and comment • Review Contract and comment • Assist in bidding process • Negotiate with vendors, suppliers, and subcontractors • Procurement • Identify long lead time items, order materials, protect site, layout, provide take-offs • Overseeing Subcontractors • Creation and enforcement of project schedules to facilitate on-time completion • Coordination of Architects and Engineers • Maintain strong working relationships with all professional groups (Architects, Engineers, Clients, and Subcontractors) • Coordinate sign-offs and inspections, make sure all project participants are on the same page and aware of the project status and responsibilities • Review Maintenance of building during construction • Develop Internal RFI/questions • Process change orders • Schedule crew and subs, review subs P.O.'s • Receive and review subcontractors Daily Reports of work done and labor and material employed. • Maintain daily work logs and sign in/out sheets and verify that workers have the necessary union affiliations and safety training. • Supervise daily project activities including but not limited to supervision of laborers, subcontractors and vendors. • Assist Project Manager in reviewing and approving the Subcontractor's monthly requests for payment. • Conduct weekly coordination meetings and monthly safety meetings with subcontractors and prepare meeting minutes. • Hold weekly toolbox and safety meetings • Review Shop Drawings and schedules, take and submit meeting minutes, suggest agenda items • Review site and project plan with PM, prepare job status report • Plan and review construction Program with Project Manager including quality control procedures, work scheduling, safety and security practices. • Ensure that all required permits or licenses have been obtained • Must have knowledge of construction safety practices, codes and related issues - Provide leadership to Site Staff and Trades - Read and completely understand Construction Docs/Specifications in their entirety - Manage Day-to-Day and weekly Site Labor/Trades work - Assist in coordination of job schedule and creating sub-contractor schedules to ensure job is completed on-time and within budget - Paperwork management to keep submittal, drawings, and other pertinent project information in order - Prepare and keep daily reports / upload job site photographs in the computer software program documenting each day's activities - Generate 2 week look ahead according to the Construction Schedule and maintaining of deadlines/milestones. Important as it may indicate potential delays of project. - Keep Record of Daily Site Labor/Trade, Hours on site and task completion - Receive and inventory deliveries (Submit Bills of Lading to PM's/APM's) - Ensure that short term project delivery/completion dates are maintained. If not then communicate with PM/APM as to why expected dates are not being met - Coordinate and communicate between trades/subcontractors to alleviate conflicts - Maintain site safety/ perform weekly toolbox talks in regards to safe working habits - Perform Quality Control on workmanship/materials/equipment - Ensure proper site housekeeping/organization is maintained - Ensure equipment/materials/fixtures are properly and securely stored to avoid damage, loss and theft - Generate/Receive emails with PM's/APM's/Trades/Subcontractors/Suppliers - Review and Approve all Trade Work Tickets if changes occur on site - Generate material lists for ordering for site labor in a timely fashion and prior to actually needing on-site to perform work. - Generate incident reports, if accident occurs and notify partners immediately
Job Type: Full-time
EDUCATION, EXPERIENCE AND SKILLS REQUIRED Five (5)+ years industry experience (Commercial & Residential) Must be hands on manager with excellent people skills as well as excellent written and verbal communication skills Knowledge of industry and OSHA safety requirements Able to read blueprints Daily Reports, weekly, project meetings Subcontractor day to day monitoring Submittal process, RFI process Skilled in multi-trade understandings Excellent Computer Skills, MS Office suite of products, Dropbox, Adobe, etc. Successful completion of in-house training Able to work at a desk when necessary as well as strap on a tool belt when required
Experience: Superintendent: 10 years (Required) Construction: 10 years (Required) License: 4 Hour Scaffold (Preferred) 30 Hour OSHA (Required) Driver's License (Required)
Please respond with asking starting Salary in Oybek. Principals only. Recruiters, please don't contact this job poster. do NOT contact us with unsolicited services or offers
item.Compensation: Please respond with asking starting Salary in Oybek

item.Title: Facade / Building Envelope Project Architect
item.Description:
New York City's leading professional firm dedicated to the preservation of buildings and infrastructure, is seeking a resourceful, skilled project architect with 5-10 years’ relevant experience to join us in executing a growing slate of challenging projects.
We’re proud to be an industry leader in crucial practice areas like facade inspections and repairs (Local Law 11), roof repairs, and investigation and remediation of structural issues. We've won numerous awards—including ten Lucy Moses preservation awards—as well as the loyalty of many of the premier public, corporate, and residential clients in the region.
Absolutely. You'll be supported by some of the most sophisticated technology in the profession, including proprietary computer applications that integrate construction drawings, specifications, cost estimating, scheduling, and construction administration; advanced photography and image processing; and state-of-the-art, non-destructive diagnostic equipment and techniques. In fact, we have an in-house studio dedicated to such supporting technology, constantly developing new digital tools (think James Bond’s “Q”). .
Honestly, we offer aspects of both. You’ll work as part of a small team assigned to projects based on synergies between project requirements and the capabilities of each team member. This gives you the dual advantages of a small office experience coupled with access to the centralized resources of a larger firm.
You’ll participate in all phases of a project from inception through completion: proposal, investigation, construction documents, bid negotiation, and construction administration. You'll have the opportunity to see your designs executed in the field and you'll take on greater responsibility and client management as soon as you are ready.
An array of building types, including courthouses, schools, universities, churches, and hospitals, and many of New York's most storied landmarks.
We embrace all components of the building envelope and underlying structure—facades, roofs, windows, and plazas—and the full complement of materials, from historic terra-cotta to high-performance curtain walls.
We offer an array of benefits and growth opportunities:
Our light-filled Tribeca office is in a landmarked building with 16' high ceilings, 8' tall windows, and stunning views of Manhattan in three directions—not a bad place to spend the work day. We’re easily accessible via public transportation: the A, C, and E Canal Street station connects directly to our building’s lobby. The N, R, 1, and 6 lines are all just a few blocks away.
Send us your resume, a cover letter with salary requirements, and a few pages of attachments (maximum of 10MB, please) or a link to your portfolio that demonstrates your experience and capabilities. We look forward to meeting you!

For additional information on our firm’s services, approach, and projects, visit

item.Title: Mid-Level Architect: 8 to 10 Years of Experience
item.Description:
Seeking Mid-Level Architect with 8+ years of experience in all phases of design including Schematic Design, Design Development, Construction Documents and a strong background in Construction Administration. The candidate should have the following:
• Must have strong background in Construction Administration • Ability to independently review submittals, respond to RFIs, and issue bulletins • Licensure in New York State is preferred • Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Architecture • Proficiency in AutoCAD 2014 or later with BIM experience a plus • Ability to coordinate the work of a multi-disciplinary team • Self-motivation and the ability to work independently • Experience with Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) and other graphic / design software including the Adobe Design Suite
Preferred project experience includes K-12 schools, higher-education projects, and design of large-scale public projects (transit stations, convention centers, and similar).
Experience and interest in sustainable design/documentation and LEED is strongly encouraged, with applicable accreditations preferred.

di Domenico + Partners, LLP is an equal opportunity employer. The firm offers a full benefits package including health insurance, dental and vision insurance, and 401(k) retirement plan.

item.Title: NYC DOB_ Architect _ Architectural Services- filing set_ Freelancer
item.Description:
Architectural Services- filing set_ Architect_ Freelancer\Independent Contractor
We are seeking an Architectural Associate/CAD drafter to create NYC DOB filing sets for commercial renovations, specifically Restaurant projects primarily in Manhattan.
RESPONSIBILITIES: • Survey existing and as-built conditions on sites located throughout the NYC area • Create Architectural Drawings and Construction Documents (Alteration Type 1 and Type 2) • Zoning Analysis and Diagrams • Drawing existing and proposed sections and elevations • Update drawing sets based on NYC Plan Examiner Objections • Prepare DOB filing set packages and coordinate with Expediter to file with Department of Buildings.
Position is an independent contractor/ freelancer

item.Title: DOB Filing Representative- Freelance
item.Description:
Job Description Filing Representative needed to file DOB Architectural filing set and certificate of correction in Manhattan NY.
Must have Class 1 or 2 Filing Representative License.
RESPONSIBILITIES:
DOB (Department of Buildings)
1. Pre-filing and E-filing for job filings (ALT 1, 2, 3, Demo, PA) 2. DOB Now Build 3. DOB Now Safety 4. DOB Now Inspections: Schedule Construction, Plumbing, Electrical inspections Delegate pertinent parties Download Pass - Final Reports and submit for sign-off Upload corrections for certifiable objections 5. DOB Permits PW 1, PW 2, PW 3, PW4, After hour variances 6. Site Safety Plans 7. Records Room research: microfilm, block and lot, folder 8. Post Approval Amendments 9. Violations (AEU2, AEU20, Dismissals, Waivers) 10. Stop Work Orders, Partial Stop Work Orders 11. Obtain New DOB Tracking Number for Contractors and insurance updates 12. Required Items submission 13. Letter of Completions 14. Temporary and Final Certificates of Occupancy 15. Schedule and attend Plan Examiner appointments to obtain approvals 16. Attend Chief Plan's examiners meetings with Architects, Engineers, Developers, Property Managers 17. Attend meetings with Deputy Borough Commissioners DOT (Department of Transportation)
1. DOT Permits: Sidewalk, Fire Hydrant, Curb Cut ECB (Environmental Control Board) 1. Attend ECB hearings 2. Process penalty payments
TOPO (Topographical Bureau)
1. Street Address Verification DOF (Department of Finance)
1. Tax Maps
FDNY (Fire Department of the city of New York)
1. Submit applications 2. Obtain Building Profiles, Notices of Violation and Violation Orders 3. Attend appointments

item.Description:
Architect
EME Consulting Engineering Group (EME)—one of New York City’s leading professional firms dedicated to energy efficiency, existing building design and sustainability—is seeking a degreed architect with 1–3 years of experience providing architectural design service for fit-out and modifications to existing spaces for EME’s educational and healthcare clients.

item.Title: Intern Mechanical Engineer
item.Description:
Opentrons makes robots for biologists. Currently, over 90% of biologists in the world run experiments with manual pipettes, moving tiny amounts of liquid from vial to vial by hand. By making robotics affordable and open, we can help all life-scientists easily execute and share their experiments. Opentrons’ robotics are in use in over 40 countries around the world and have been adopted by top-tier institutions like Stanford, Harvard, Merck, and Roche.
We’re interested in candidates who are working toward a BA/BS in mechanical engineering with background/experience in the following: • Prototyping processes : 3D printing, Laser cut • Design for production methods • SolidWorks • Passionate about products

item.Title: EXPERIENCED ARCHITECT/ DRAFTER
item.Description:
LOOKING TO HIRE EXPERIENCED ARCHITECT/ DRAFTER MUST KNOW AND BE ABLE TO DO NYC ZONING CALCULATIONS, CODES REVIEW AND PLAN REQUIREMENTS FOR DOB SUBMITTAL FAMILIAR WITH DOB PAPERWORK. CLASS TWO DOB ID IS A PLUS.
REQUIREMENTS: - Must have 5-year Bachelor of Architecture degree and minimum 3 years working experience in single family residential design and mixed-use buildings - Must have knowledge of NYC zoning and building codes - Must be able to develop design concepts into a full set of construction drawings independently - Must be a very organized team player with excellent communication skills. Must feel comfortable/confident to be the liaison between office, clients, contractors and consultants - Strong AutoCad skills - Must be able to manage multiple projects EMAIL YOUR RESUME.

item.Title: Architect/Designer
item.Description:
We are an established and awarded small architectural firm located in Manhattan. Our projects cover public buildings and educational facilities. We are looking to hire talented individuals who have the potential and ambition for growth towards positions in office leadership. Our office organization enables staff members a hands-on experience. Working on multiple projects and different phases of work, including design, construction documents and job administration. Our transparent office environment provides exposure to all aspects of the practice. Qualifications: • Be a US citizen or be permitted to work in the USA • Professional degree in Architecture • Skill in Autocad and presentation software. Revit capability a plus. • USA experience in design, detailing and construction administration. • Verbal and writing abilities. Work description: • Participate in the design and production of multiple projects at all design and project administration phases. • Attend site meetings and prepare minutes. Observe and document progress and quality of construction work. • Communicate with in-house staff, consultants and clients. • Demonstrate skill in the use of drafting and presentation software.

item.Description:

item.Title: CAD DRAWING /DESIGN /SALES
item.Description:
CAD DRAWING STORE DESIGNER / SALES PERSON needed.
Come join one of the largest store fixture companies on the east coast.
Use your CAD skills to design store floorplans and custom display furniture for large retail companies.
We design pharmacies, jewelry stores, supermarkets, cigar stores, eye glass stores, and much more.

item.Description:

item.Title: Intermediate Architect
item.Description:

The staff at AMP Architecture is diverse in design, engineering, estimating and construction. Each of our team members bring individualized expertise within their respective backgrounds, creating an inclusive environment breeding excellence in design and construction.
Job Responsibilities: - Drafting 1-4 family wood framed residential homes based off initial measurements and photos. - Completing and filing Department of Building alteration type 1,2 and 3 applications. - Assisting architects and engineers on site visits to measure and draft new projects. - Complete site visit reports with photo documentation. - Daily correspondence with team to provide updates on status of all current projects.
Qualifications: - 4-5 year BA in Architecture from a NAAB accredited architecture program required. - 1-2 years experience in residential wood framed construction. - Experience with filing applications with NYC DOB. - Proficiency with AutoCAD. - Strong computer skills. - Organized and able to multi-task.
- Construction Management experience preferred.

item.Title: Drafter
item.Description: Construction company specializing in Exterior Restoration will hire a draftsman. Knowledge of Autocad necessary.

item.Title: Structural Engineer
item.Description:
Job Description:
We are currently seeking structural engineers at multiple levels to join our team. As a structural engineer, you will work with other team members in our highly collaborative environment to assure that designs are developed in accordance with appropriate codes and standards, quality control objectives are achieved, and project goals are met within the schedule and budget. This is an outstanding opportunity for a structural engineer to work on a variety of high-profile projects throughout the region.
Duties and Responsibilities:
- Coordinate with architects, contractors, owners, and other engineers from the initial planning stages through final construction. - Determine design criteria using relevant codes and standards. - Analyze and/or prepare models and calculations for various structural elements and systems by using various software and/or hand calculations. - Develop contract documents, including construction drawings and technical specifications - Produce schematic and detailed designs and evaluation of planning and concept alternatives - Review shop drawings, RFI's. - Perform field inspections and write inspection reports.
Skills and Qualifications:
- Familiar with latest version of AutoCAD, Revit, ETABS, SAP2000, SAFE, RAM, Excel. - Excellent verbal and written communication skills - Ability to effectively work independently and collaboratively in a team environment - Must be eligible to work in the United States
Entry Level Candidates: - Bachelor’s degree in Civil or Structural Engineering.
Intermediate Level Candidates: - Master’s degree in Civil or Structural Engineering. - 3+ years of related work experience in concrete or steel framing building structural design, support-of-excavation and foundation system design, steel or concrete rebar shop drawing design, construction support design and field inspection.
Advance Level Candidates: - Master’s degree in Civil or Structural Engineering. - 8+ years of related work experience in concrete or steel framing building structural design, support-of-excavation and foundation system design, steel or concrete rebar shop drawing design, construction support design and field inspection. - NYS PE License
item.Compensation: The salary is based on level of experience.

item.Title: Architectural Studio Assistant - entry level
item.Description:
Perfect introduction to work in Architect's office for a recent grad or as a follow up to a summer internship! Previous experience is not a requirement, just motivation to assist in a busy office and learn the rhythms of day-to-day practice.
We are a 10-ish person firm located in Chelsea, doing interesting design work for projects of all scales in nyc from New Buildings to polished interior renovations.
The position is full time and duties generally include: -assisting architects -managing the materials library -material and product research -managing images/assembling porfolio presentations -maintaining website and other media -light drafting -general studio organization -printing and reproduction -office oversight of phones, messengers, ordering supplies etc.
Skillset should include: -basic photoshop -basic autocad for printing and light drafting -microsoft office suite
We hope to cultivate young architects and there are opportunities for growth for motivated candidates. Please forward resume / letter / a few work examples.

item.Title: Furniture, Fixtures & Equipment Designer
item.Description:
Luxury focused, international interior design firm founded in London seeks focused, resourceful and passionate mid-level FF&E designer to work closely with a team of interior designers and FF&E specialists on multiple projects in their growing New York office.
Confident, discriminating and with the ability to innovate the successful candidate for this role will possess excellent communication skills and the important ability to balance playfulness with luxury. This role presents a wonderful opportunity to work for one of the most highly respected designers in the world on some of the most exclusive and eclectic projects anywhere.
Key Responsibilities:
-Be strategic and highlight important issues throughout the project phases whilst maintaining a dedication to great design
-Generate control books and schedules for a wide range of items from soft home, moveable furniture and lighting to finishes, architectural accessories, hardware, decorative and fine art.
-Manage several projects concurrently maintaining a calm focus and an atmosphere of productivity and accuracy even under pressure
-Coordinate and maintain close relationships with all FF&E purchasing agents from research to procurement and installation
-Create design concepts, presentations, resource images and draw highly detailed and complex custom furniture
-Source a variety of unusual and custom products and samples from vendors to assist in developing unique material solutions, ironmongery, lighting and sanitary wear products
Skills and Experience:
-A minimum of 3 years experience in a design position and a professional degree in interior design or furniture/industrial design
-Be adaptable, creative, characterful, organized and passionate
-A high level of comfort and experience making FF&E designs and using control books
-A professional and warm demeanor and proficiency in delivering clear neat design presentations
-Have the aptitude to work both autonomously and in teams
-Demonstrate a high degree of experience with AutoCAD, Adobe Creative Suite and hand sketching
From residences to restaurants, private members clubs and important global hotels this opportunity offers scope for great variety. With projects all over the world and an amazing reputation for exuberant and luxurious design this is an exciting opportunity to join a diverse and renowned team. This opportunity for a discerning, thorough and multifaceted creative professional is a rare opportunity to be involved in the creation of many wonderful and celebrated projects. Great salary and benefits for the successful candidate.

item.Title: Senior/intermediate Architect
item.Description:
Meridian Design Associates, Architects, P.C. is a medium-sized award-winning and well-published New York City-based architectural firm. Our practice is quite varied, with both new construction and renovation/interiors, including media and entertainment facilities, corporate work, multi-family residential, and high-end residential. We are an entrepreneurial, innovative firm which places a strong emphasis on initiative and client service. We do a substantial number of projects outside New York City, including current jobs in Florida, Connecticut, and New Jersey. We place a heavy emphasis on computer tools and require that our professionals have strong digital production skills, including ArchiCAD, Revit, SketchUp and other graphic software. Presentation and 3D modeling skills are very important. Microsoft Office (Word, Excel) is a must.
We are looking for senior to intermediate staff with 4 or more years work experience capable of doing production, building law analysis, and design and project management.
Responsibilities: • Intensive interaction with firm principals and teams, as well as with clients, consultants and contractors. • Design concepts presentations • Design coordination and detailing • Attend project meetings, take meeting notes
Requirements: • Degree in Architecture/Interior Design • 4+ years of project experience in all phases of design • Experience in 2D/3D software, including ArchiCAD, Revit, SketchUp and other graphic software (Photoshop, InDesign). Proficiency in ArchiCAD preferred. Microsoft Office (Word, Excel) is a must. • Strong graphic and visualization skills to communicate design presentations • Strong leadership, communication, organizations skills and the ability to work on multiple projects at the same time. • Knowledge of materials, construction techniques, and local building codes We provide excellent salary and benefits.
item.Compensation: Salary based on experience, with generous benefit package

item.Title: Career Opportunity in Engineering for Immigrant Professionals
item.Description:
The Cooper Union Retraining Program for Immigrant Engineers @ CAMBA assists immigrant Engineers and IT Professionals who are underemployed or unemployed gain access to higher paying jobs through training and job placement assistance. The program includes courses in information technology and mechanical, electrical and civil engineering taught by Cooper Union faculty and field experts. All services are free and admission is competitive. Classes Available:
Engineering: - OSHA 30 for Construction - Heating, Ventilation, Air-Condition & Refrigeration - Building Operation, Maintenance & Safety Regulations - National Electrical Code (NEC) & its applications - Bridge, Highway, Tunnels and Buildings: Professional Practice for Cost Estimating - Green Building Guidelines & Environmental Safety - AISC Structural Steel Design - ACI Structural Concrete Design - AutoCAD and Revit
Information Technology: - Data Architecture Principles, Data Structure and SQL - Java Programming - Microsoft .NET and C# - Software Quality Assurance—Manual Testing - Software Quality Assurance—Automated Testing - Linux (UNIX) Administration - Android Software Development - Cyber Security
Eligibility Requirements: - Be born outside of the United States and be authorized to work in the United States - Have a bachelor's degree or higher and professional experience in the field of engineering, information technology, or a related field from the country of origin (not from U.S) - Have lived in the U.S. less than five full years - Be unemployed, underemployed, or working in a field not related to your education - Have intermediate+ English fluency - Demonstrate a financial need - Be highly motivated to pursue professional job search
You can learn more about us and apply here: www.cooper.edu/immigrant-retraining.
Please call at 718.226.0437 if you have any additional questions about the program or to determine your eligibility.
item.Compensation: Free training in Engineering and IT field with placement assistance!

Responsibilities include, but not limited to: Coordinate and develop construction documents Take on technically challenging issues with Project Manager Perform code and zoning analyses Review and redline drawings Oversee drafters, as required by the project Produce deliverables without requiring constant supervision Coordinate meetings with consultants Organize and lead site visits and surveys Conduct material research and meet with vendor as necessary, to understand materials and products Take initiative to complete work
Requirements: Bachelor’s Degree in Architecture 3+ years’ experience in an Architect’s office working on Commercial/Retail projects Must be proficient in Revit and other applicable industry software is a must General understanding of codes and zoning General knowledge of building details and construction process Positive attitude and driven to succeed
Compensation and Benefits: • We offer a competitive salary and benefits package commensurate with the level of experience and a creative and innovative work environment. • Our benefit package includes Medical/Dental/Vision insurance, 401k Retirement Plan, Flexible Spending, Paid Time Off, Holidays and much more. • Our company culture features professional learning and growth opportunities, rewarding project types to participate in and free ongoing professional educational programs.
Interested candidates should forward their cover letter and resume Please include Job Captain in the subject. No phone calls, please.

item.Title: Facade / Building Envelope Structural Engineer
item.Description:
, New York City's leading professional firm dedicated to the preservation of buildings and infrastructure, is seeking a resourceful, skilled structural engineer with 5 to 6 years of building envelope restoration experience if licensed, and 7 to 10 years' experience if not licensed, to join us in executing a growing slate of challenging projects.
We work on an array of building types, including courthouses, schools, universities, churches, and hospitals, and many of New York's most storied landmarks, from Trinity Church to Grand Central Terminal. Our work embraces all components of the building envelope and underlying structure—facades, roofs, windows, and plazas—and the full complement of materials, from historic terra-cotta to high-performance curtain walls. We’re proud to be an industry leader in crucial practice areas like Local Law 11 inspections and repairs. We've won numerous awards, as well as the loyalty of many of the premier public, corporate, and residential clients in the region.
You’ll work as part of a small team assigned to projects based on synergies between project requirements and the capabilities of each team member. This arrangement offers employees the dual advantages of a small office experience coupled with access to the centralized resources of a larger firm. You'll be supported by some of the most sophisticated technology in the profession, including proprietary computer systems and applications, advanced photography and image processing, and state-of-the-art, non-destructive diagnostic equipment and techniques.
Typically, you’ll participate in all phases of a project from inception through completion: proposal, investigation, construction documents, bid negotiation, and construction administration. You'll have the opportunity to see your designs executed in the field and you'll take on greater responsibility and client management as soon as you are ready.
We offer an array of benefits and growth opportunities: :
Our light-filled Tribeca office is in a landmarked building with 16' high ceilings, 8' tall windows, and stunning views of Manhattan in three directions—not a bad place to spend the work day. We’re easily accessible via public transportation: the A, C, and E Canal Street station connects directly to our building’s lobby. The N, R, 1, and 6 lines are all just a few blocks away.
If you’re excited about this opportunity, please send us your resume, a cover letter with salary requirements, and a few pages of attachments (maximum of 10MB, please) or link to your portfolio that demonstrates your experience and capabilities.
With thanks for your interest, please note that only those candidates under consideration will be contacted.
For additional information on our firm’s services, approach, and projects, visit

-Ability to create project schedules/timelines.

-Complete understanding of subcontracting and procurement strategies.

About AIK Renovations: AIK is a leading commercial and residential contractor based in New York City. Incorporating the highest quality materials and state-of-the-art construction techniques in conjunction with superior project coordination and construction supervision, AIK strives to surpass our clients’ expectations while delivering unique projects on time and within budget.

Job Purpose Summary:
The Project Manager is responsible to manage and consult on multiple construction-consulting projects through project closeout or consulting resolution. The Project Manager, along with the Senior Project Manager, will act as Beacon’s main client contacts for the project(s). Beacon provides construction consulting services which include construction management, assisting surety companies with assessment/completion of troubled construction projects, cost estimating, claim analysis, and assessment of construction defects.
Key Responsibilities:
• Communicating with the project contacts (ie: client, obligee, principal, attorneys, subcontractors and vendors) on a day-to-day basis • Attending project meetings • Investigating and assessing construction projects • Analyzing and preparing the project cost to complete reports • Establishing reserve recommendations • Developing completion strategies • Preparing project status reports for client • Preparing bid packages • Analyzing construction claims • Reviewing payment bond claims • Ratifying subcontractor agreements • Monitoring the completion of projects through closeout • Preparing and analyzing project schedules • Negotiating change orders and claims • Reviewing work of the Project Engineer
Experience Required:
• Accredited degree in Engineering or Construction Management • Minimum of 5 years experience in engineering or construction management of public work projects such as roadways, schools or public transportation and/or large commercial construction projects such as universities, hospitals or hotels • Construction accounting/estimating background required • Has demonstrated success in managing or the potential to manage large construction projects • Extremely proficient in MS Office software, especially Word, Excel and PowerPoint • Knowledge of Primavera Scheduling software is a plus • CADD experience preferred • Strong leadership and decision-making skills • Strong communication, organization and analytical skills • Self-motivated and capable of handling multiple projects
If interested, please contact: Karen Anderson, Business Manager Beacon Consulting Group, Inc. kanderson@beacon.ws
item.Compensation: Compensation to be determined based on knowledge and experience.

item.Title: Mechanical - HVAC Engineer
item.Description: Mechanical - HVAC Engineer for small NYC Consulting firm. Must be proficient in AUTOCAD. P.E. or P.E. qualified preferred. Fax your resume to (646) 357-9735

item.Title: Local Law 11 Inspector / Engineer
item.Description: Established mid-size structural engineering design firm in the Flatiron District of Manhattan, New York City with a wide variety of projects focused on new constructions and renovations for both small- and large-scale residential and commercial buildings in the tri-state area. The Intermediate Level Local Law 11 Inspector position is for someone in the Structural/Civil Engineering or Architectural field with at least 3 years of experience and knowledge, who possesses a well-organized and detail-oriented solid background in conducting site visits to do inspections for Local Law 11. The candidate should be able to organize and put together complete sets of construction documents as well as coordinating with architectural and other consultants, clients and contractors. Additionally, the candidate should be able to produce reports containing photographs and text. This position is a great opportunity for experience and growth! Please submit resume/cover letter, work samples and salary requirements by email. Job Type: • Full-time Job Location: • New York, NY Required Education: • Bachelor’s (minimum) Work Authorization: • United States (required) Required Language: • Fluent in English Required Knowledge of Software: • Microsoft Office Word and Excel • Drafting/AutoCAD • ETABS, SAFE, RAMS Structure, ASDIP Suites, ENERCAL • Knowledge of Revit a plus, but not required Preferred Traits: • Ability to take direction, work independently, and handle changing and evolving directives. • Able to prioritize & concurrently service multiple projects & meet deadlines. • Be a team player and have the ability to complete tasks accurately and efficiently. • Effective problem solving & interpersonal skills & the ability to interface with all clients & employees. • Interacts well with other disciplines & clients in a manner that builds productive relationships. • Strong ability to detail and manage the production of multiple complex projects at the same time. • Detail-oriented to ensure that plans and sections coordinate, eliminating inaccuracies during production.

item.Title: Facade / Building Envelope Structural Engineer
item.Description:
, New York City's leading professional firm dedicated to the preservation of buildings and infrastructure, is seeking a resourceful, skilled structural engineer with 5 to 6 years of building envelope restoration experience if licensed, and 7 to 10 years' experience if not licensed, to join us in executing a growing slate of challenging projects.
We work on an array of building types, including courthouses, schools, universities, churches, and hospitals, and many of New York's most storied landmarks, from Trinity Church to Grand Central Terminal. Our work embraces all components of the building envelope and underlying structure—facades, roofs, windows, and plazas—and the full complement of materials, from historic terra-cotta to high-performance curtain walls. We’re proud to be an industry leader in crucial practice areas like Local Law 11 inspections and repairs. We've won numerous awards, as well as the loyalty of many of the premier public, corporate, and residential clients in the region.
You’ll work as part of a small team assigned to projects based on synergies between project requirements and the capabilities of each team member. This arrangement offers employees the dual advantages of a small office experience coupled with access to the centralized resources of a larger firm. You'll be supported by some of the most sophisticated technology in the profession, including proprietary computer systems and applications, advanced photography and image processing, and state-of-the-art, non-destructive diagnostic equipment and techniques.
Typically, you’ll participate in all phases of a project from inception through completion: proposal, investigation, construction documents, bid negotiation, and construction administration. You'll have the opportunity to see your designs executed in the field and you'll take on greater responsibility and client management as soon as you are ready.
We offer an array of benefits and growth opportunities: :
Our light-filled Tribeca office is in a landmarked building with 16' high ceilings, 8' tall windows, and stunning views of Manhattan in three directions—not a bad place to spend the work day. We’re easily accessible via public transportation: the A, C, and E Canal Street station connects directly to our building’s lobby. The N, R, 1, and 6 lines are all just a few blocks away.
If you’re excited about this opportunity, please send us your resume, a cover letter with salary requirements, and a few pages of attachments (maximum of 10MB, please) or link to your portfolio that demonstrates your experience and capabilities.
With thanks for your interest, please note that only those candidates under consideration will be contacted.
For additional information on our firm’s services, approach, and projects, visit

item.Description: Architectural and Permit Expediting firm of 29 years located in Tribeca is seeking full-time permit expeditor, Class 2 preferred. Please reply through the Craigslist email relay with a resume and contact info. Thanks!

item.Title: Part time Architectural / Civil Engineering intern (NYC)
item.Description: Small Manhattan based consulting / inspection firm looking for an Intern, preferably an Architecture , Civil engineering or Interior design student / individual to assist with writing field reports related to construction progress, primarily in Manhattan and Brooklyn. This is a freelance / part time position ranging from 10-30 hours per week, working on construction sites and assisting in preparing progress reports. Experience working with MS office, PDF and good reading writing skills is essential. This part time position provides an invaluable opportunity to learn about architectural and structural design and construction aspects of all types of buildings, from residential townhouses, penthouses, to commercial and retail building retrofit. Availability in the mornings is essential. Please submit resume

item.Title: Office Assistant
item.Description: Looking for Office assistant for Professional firm, experience in Corporate office required. Excellent interpersonal skills, pleasant phone manner and proficient in Word, Excel and Outlook are required. Full benefits package.
